LanguageData.ZP_Amazake.label: Amazake
LanguageData.ZP_Amazake.description: This traditional, low-alcohol beverage is often served in Japan at Shinto Shrines during New Year's or other festivals.\nMade from fermented rice and generally heated to a simmer, Amazake tends to have a white, cloudy appearance.\nMany believe it has great nutritional value. Amazake can be served cold in the Summer, to help escape the heat; or, as is more often the case, it's used during the Winter ward off the cold.
